<Time>1579810264540</Time><rate>4</rate>< Review>
It's dirty, bad smelling place (smell of wet brushed coloured hair with hint of burned hair due to using of hairdryer). Place looks shabby a d definitely not contemporary. BUT, there are always a least 2-3 people in line, waiting for haircut, often kids age 7 and up. Price for regular kids haircut is ridiculous - $10. They made it well enough, so I gave them 4 stars (but please, use sweeper after each client, setup ventilation system, put some good kids books, so kids will read instead of watching TV while waiting for their cuts).<//Review>

My girlfriend came to get highlights done on the bottom half of her hair. The man that did her hair dyed her roots brown when she asked to specifically not dye them. They refused to refund her and all they offered in exchange was a deep condition treatment. How is that going to fix her hair when it‚Äôs already breaking apart? Do not waste your time with this place, find somewhere that actually knows what they are doing.</Text>

<Text>Their Micheladas are great. The food is on par with the best. There is plenty of seating & awesome atmosphere being next to Edwards Theater. Most definitely recommend this restaurant to friends & family. **UPDATE** after coming here quiet a few times, I've noticed the customer service is not the best. Even without a line, for some reason or another the staff is always in their back kitchen, having us wait for them. Every Michelada Monday their miches are supposed to be on special & I always got charged the original price, each time having to bring it to their attention. To finish it off the big banner outside says they are open daily at 7am for breakfast. I show up just after 7 for some breakfast, the girl is just opening up & she tells me they are not open yet because the cook was not in yet. If management worked on the customer service this place would be as great as it has the potential to be. **UPDATE** This place is great, I'm glad management has listened to what the customer has to say & applied it to their business. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food & even better drinks. Their micheladas are in my opinion the best in town.< /Text>< Pictures>

<Review>We took our cat on a Tuesday to Acacia Animal Hospital because she had an eye infection. We had to leave her there for about 3 hours; we returned; paid the bill; and were given an eye antibiotic. By the way, the vet never met nor spoke with us. We were told to call back in 7 days to inform them of her condition and were told if there was  little or no progress they'd see her on day 7 for further diagnosis and a much more expensive treatment. My wife called the office on day 6 because our little girl's eye was not responding to the medication and we wanted to make sure that we could have a reservation for day 7. We did not get a call back that day. My wife called again on days 7, 8 and 9. My wife left messages, morning and afternoon on those days. She also left a text message with the girl who we met with and she was the person who took our cat inside for the exam. By day 10, NO ONE HAD CALLED US BACK and WE WERE DONE.

My wife frantically called Animal Medical Center to make an appointment to have her eye examined AGAIN..By the time our little girl was first seen at Acacia,15 DAYS HAD PASSED and there was very little improvement with Acacia's medication. We were so worried that she may go blind in that eye. At Acacia we were promptly met outside and not long after the doctor met with us outside. She told us that a stronger medicine was now being used. It's been 6 days now using it and her eye is near fully open and she has a more green eye again rather than that blackish color. Our little girl is now sleeping better and more playful again. Now she rarely fights us when we apply the medicine.

In summary, we feel there was ZERO customer service nor professionalism at Acacia. Obviously, WE ARE VERY UNHAPPY  with Acacia Animal Hospital. We will never recommend them nor ever go back there....WE ARE SO DONE.<//Review>< user>

< review>
I have 3 cats.  I started using Acacia Vet hospital about a couple of years ago.  Luckily all of the visits were basic shots, teeth cleaning and yearly checkups.   A couple of months ago I started using the litter that turns colors if there's a problem with the urine.  When I saw that the color turned blue I figured out that it was one or both of my senior girl cats.  I took them in and had  them tested and both have kidney disease.  I had to change their diets and start giving them sub fluid treatments.  This was a really scary thing for me to do since poking needles in my cats was the last thing I imaged that I would have to do in my senior years.  Everyone at Acacia, Dr. Bath and all of her employees have been so helpful to me during this stressful time especially Deedee.  She trained me on how to administer the fluids and has been there for me with patience, understanding and advice.  I appreciate everything that they have help me and my girls with during this time.< /review>

I finally got a call from the doctor on Monday afternoon.  she said I would receive a call from her staff when I should come pick up her medication. < Text>
Dr. Bath has been caring for my dog (Rocco), for a few years now.
She takes as much time as you need during your visit to resolve your pet's issues. The office is very clean, with no pet odors. The staff is always attentive and helpful.
During this pandemic, it is a little difficult, because you have to let your pet go in alone, however, they do their best to keep you informed on the treatment process. The prices are resonable and affordable. They also offer a senior discount.
I would recommend this clinic for your pet's needs.<//Text>

<UserId.>102953752407008009543< /UserId.><username>Gio Tavanlar IV</username>< Time>
1551063397131< /Time>
< rate>
5<//rate>
< Review>
Its warm inside in the dead of winter. The wooden bed is softer than the street which you forget about in the privacy of your own room. Not many places can turn the feeling of hopelessness into gratitude. Five stars for this place not for how it is, but what it does. Five stars not for what it features, but for what it means. Those who have passed through "The Russ" as we call it,  may not talk about it  but The Russ  is always close to our hearts.</Review>

<Text>The Russ hotel is not a real hotel anymore.  It's home for many for those you don't have a home. It houses homeless people with mental health problems.  It's a wonderful place to get help get your life on track. If you are homeless or know someone who is homeless with a mental health problems.  This place is hard to get into but its worth a try. It's not a safe area for women and Children.  And for Anyone walking alone at night. This place is in Los Angels skid row.  So their is a lot of  people always walking around.  If you are not from the area be careful walking around here. There is a lot of crime. Drug use and sales and gang activity.  If you look out of place they will Rob you and jump you. So be careful down in this area.<//Text><Pictures>None</Pictures>< Resp>

<user_id>116367438380976946283<//user_id><rating>4</rating>< Resp>

< Review>
The Russ Hotel is an amazing resource for the homeless community. I am grateful for organizations like SRO Housing Corporation and the entire staff for making the resources available to men and women in need.

There are many men and women who seek the service in the skid row area Los Angeles and it is only because organizations like the SRO Housing Corporation that those needs can be met.  I would personally like to thank  Gabriel, Yulonda, Sonya and Carlos of SRO Housing Corporation, along with the many other organizations in the community that provide resources to help alleviate homelessness in Los Angeles. They helped save many lives and I am grateful for them each and everyday.

Christopher
The Family Foundation  Partnership< /Review>

< review>
Best breakfast I‚Äôve had in years. Country ham was high-quality - not at all the reasonably tasty slab you usually get, and browned perfectly. Eggs, poached, were excellent. Grits: beyond language. Even the piece of bread was extraordinary. For me, portion was just right: filling, but not grotesquely so.

Service was attentive and courteous; waiting for each step was nominal.

With small OJ and coffee, bill was 20.71 (pre-tip). More than fair. You can quite easily spend far more for lesser food in this neighborhood.< /review>

< review>
A little slice of New Orleans in Santa Rosa. It's always busy, especially for brunch, but it's always worth the wait. Great beignets and coffee, awesome brunch items, and spectacular Bloody Mary's. I wouldn't bring a large group because it's a bit small but for an intimate breakfast, this is the spot. Kinda pricey but not overpriced for the quality of the experience.</review>

< Review>
Great restaurant, two locations (Santa Rosa and Healdsburg), serves breakfast and lunch. We love this place and go there often for breakfast. The crawfish and andouille omelet is my favorite, so good. The beignets are a must if you visit. The eggs sardou is my second favorite, it's a benedict that uses artichoke bottoms instead of english muffins, which is interesting and delicious. We love getting a side of grits with butter and maple syrup. Everything on the menu is good, we take a lot of friends and no one is ever disappointed!</Review>

<Rating>4< /Rating><review>Good Poboys. BUT...their remoulade is nowhere near new orleans style and is mustard based. The gumbo is not really gumbo at all and is too thick and is more like a red beans/ gumbo mix. It is still good tho. The beignets are on point and almost as good as Cafe Du Monde in Nola. The po boy "sammiches"come STANDARD with mayo  (like what in the actual!??!?!* go to acme, go to felixes, go to commanders, go to some real Nola eateries and tell me this is proper)?!?!? I almost left at that point but it was still leaps and bounds better than eating at Guy Fiere's restaurant... This place needs a few changes to be great! This is coming from my experience managing and running 2 different types of very successful restaurants in this (cajun/creole) genre and living in NOLA for many years. < Text>
I am devastated and heartbroken to recently discover that my favorite eatery is shuttered forever in Sonoma County.
The pandemic and the cost of doing business in California has done them in.
I have no words. This place was a regular culinary delight and I will surely miss it.
My deepest condolences and sympathies to the owners of this wonderful eatery serving delicious habit forming cajun cusine.
I will miss you beyond words!
Thank you for consistent excellance and always making me want more.
I wish you the very best moving forward and all those folks in Tennessee just don't know how lucky they are to have you establish in their community!
Original review:
Wow find this place and find food heaven.
Unique and spectacular in every way from the succulent authentic menu items to the decor and music.
New Orleans in Santa Rosa and Healdsburg. Everything on the menu is outstanding including the popular shrimp po-boy sandwich and the Gumbo, to die for delicious!
Be careful, this place could be habit forming.
My highest recommendation for a unique and delicious meal in downtown Santa Rosa.
Nuff said. üëçü§†</Text>

< text>
Pizza was very "blah", missed the sauces I ordered as well.

Staff mark the pizza tracker steps as done long before they take place, example, it was marked delivered 15 minutes before I got it, which was almost 45 minutes after it was marked as out for delivery. Called manager Soroco and she offered no explanation or excuse and seemed surprised that I noticed. This has happened several times before and the last time I called a jr staffer said management tells them to fake the entries so they get good reports on the cook/delivery times. Shameful.

I gave up on Domino's many years ago because of bad service and bland food. When their new CEO very publicly promised they learned and things would change I gave them a second chance and actually was happy with the turn-around. It seems its back to business as usual though, sigh.</text>

0x80dcedcdd5f264cf:0x3450b688f2c292c1< /Gmap_id>
<user_name>Dan Galietto< /user_name>< Text>
Do not order their roasted potatoes unless you like cold and soggy (most likely microwaved) frozen hash brown potatoes with 2 large scoops of raw, grocery-store minced garlic dumped on top. Their rice is okay, their chicken is good, their meat is very good but for the same cost you get three times as much elsewhere. I might have been okay with the portions had I not tried the $5 paper bucket of raw potatoes first. I wanted to like this place and I like to support new restaurants. I had just tried the taco place next door not too long ago and we all really liked it. These places are all hurting for customers and if you want to see a place stay open beyond COVID you gotta help them pay the rent. Anyway, thought I would give this place a shot but I won't be going back. After the potatoes, I just don't know how an establishment can expect to be taken seriously and develop a great customer base. The place was clean, the restroom was off limits, I ordered 2 of the "combo platters" and each had about three to five little pieces of meat or chicken, some grilled onions, some grilled veggies and the rest rice.<//Text>

1617319632016<//Date>
<Name>SloMo Bay<//Name>< Pics>
None</Pics>
<text>I have been a loyal Ford customer for many years. In the last 5 years alone I‚Äôve purchased 2 Escapes, 2 Edge Sports, and an F-150. To say I like Ford would be an understatement. Until... I had an unfortunate event that led me to Perry Ford of Santa Barbara.

My F-150 had a transmission failure while I was on the 101 freeway. I thought I had lucked out because Perry Ford was nearby (I don‚Äôt live near there) so I asked the tow truck driver to take it there. Upon arrival I was told they would take a look at it the following day and get back to me. After waiting all day, without a return call I called them and was told they had not looked at it yet. I‚Äôm a patient guy so I waited until the following week and called back to discover they were just starting to look at it. A week after that they told me they had submitted the issue to Ford (warranty issue) and were waiting to hear back. They promised to call me back but never did. Two weeks later (and multiple failed return calls) they finally got approval to order parts from Ford. They promised me that as soon as the parts came in they would get right on it, but once again (after the parts came in) they hadn‚Äôt done any work. Needless to say I filed a complaint with Ford Motor which suddenly got them working on my truck but even then it took another week. Finally, 5 weeks later, after several failed promises and failures to communicate with me, I was told my truck is ready.  At that point I was ready to forgive all and part on a friendly basis. But of course my transmission crapped out on my way home and it‚Äôs now at another Ford dealership waiting to get a whole transmission replacement.

Hands down the worst overall service experience I have ever received from a Ford dealership. When I‚Äôm traveling I take my vehicle to Ford because their techs are usually great, repairs are completed in a timely manner, and the customer service is stellar. I experienced the polar opposite at Perry Ford. Long story short; My diesel van started experiencing the same transmission leak that I brought it in for right after leaving their lot, I ended up waiting nearly 3 weeks for repairs that should‚Äôve taken a week and half, and their communication was awful. Please read the several other poor service reviews here as well. Read on for the full story.

I dropped my van off with a transmission leak, exhaust, and A/C issues on a Thursday. Daryl said they should be able to diagnose the next day or Saturday. I did not receive an update and left a voicemail on Saturday which went unreturned. I called on Monday, left another message that went unreturned, and after a few call attempts was able to reach Daryl who said they would be able to diagnose tomorrow, which they were able to do. 6k for all of the repairs and I was aware that it was a good bit of work for everything so I was prepared to wait a week for parts to arrive and service competed. The parts did not arrive for a week (typical parts delivery is under 48 hours from LA). I again experienced unreturned messages and difficulty reaching someone there during this time. At this point I had been at an RV park for a week and a half with my camper trailer.

After the parts arrived on Tuesday Daryl said repairs should be complete in a few days. On Thursday I called in for an update (it took several attempts...again) and Daryl said it would be done tomorrow by end of day. By Friday end of day he ‚Äúpromised‚Äù it would be done Monday. End of day Monday, ‚Äúsorry, it will be done tomorrow‚Äù.

The van was completed on Tuesday (2.5 half weeks since I dropped it off). Relieved and eager to continue my drive up to Seattle, I set off. After stopping to get fuel I noticed the transmission was leaking from THE SAME PLACES THAT IT WAS LEAKING FROM BEFORE. I am now at another Ford dealership in San Jose awaiting repairs and a warranty claim against Perry.

Daryl did knock off $500 from the bill for the extended delay. I was calm and patient throughout the entire repair as I understand shops are busy, perhaps they‚Äôre understaffed/overworked, etc. However, after experiencing the same issue that I initially came in for the amount that I had just spent, I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed with every facet of my experience at Perry Ford.<//Review>

< Text>
I really like my service advisor; he is sharp and cares about his customers. However, he is massively overworked. They had my car for 3 weeks. He doesn't have time for personalized care or to regularly follow up on status. I had to call them once a week, myself, to check on it. In the end, the mechanic didn't find or fix the cause of my issue, although he did detect it. In the past, I have also found that they are not good at finding or fixing squeaks and rattles, which was not the problem for this visit.

The dealership is very crowded. They have too much inventory for their size, and cars are crammed in everywhere. There is almost always a backup of vehicles and customers at the service booths. It is difficult to get in and out due to the high congestion.

The dealership facility is generally dirty and tired looking. The management clearly does not value cleanliness. Reinforcing this point, they do not wash vehicles that have been serviced, as most dealerships in Santa Barbara do.  My car was so filthy when I picked it up (and it was spotless when I dropped it off), you would have thought it was left parked in a hay field with the combine driving all around it for three weeks covering it with debris.

If you can go elsewhere, I would recommend avoiding Perry Ford Mazda.<//Text>

- Motorcraft Synthetic oil change and filter
- Tire Rotation (NOT PERFORMED)
- Brake Inspection
- Fluid Top-Off
- Battery Test (NOT PERFORMED)
- Filter Check (NOT PERFORMED)
- BELTS and Hoses check (NOT PERFORMED)

When my son picked up the car they charged him $88.05 for the oil change and $17.48 for each wiper blade for a total of $34.96

<Date>1589059335991< /Date><pictures>None<//pictures><Text>5 stars.

Prior to our visit, we had done car shopping in Oxnard, Ventura, Santa Maria, LA, and SLO.

We had a great start to end experience with the entire staff thought the process of purchasing a brand new vehicle and trading in a used vehicle. Initially, we started communicating with Tina who is the online sales manager and had conversations with the Andy, the dealership manager. We set up an appointment to come in and test drive a vehicle. The test drive went well and then we got to the sales and numbers conversation which went smoothly. Obviously, you do some back and forth, but if you do your research and due diligence, your back and forth becomes a shorter process. Then we worked with the finance manager and closed out all the paperwork. Everyone who we interacted with was friendly, professional, well informed, prepared and basically we worked toward a goal: for us walk away with a vehicle at a fair price, for them make the sale.

Great experience and we will go back for future Ford/Mazda purchases.< /Text>< rating>

< text>
My 2013 Ford Escape broke down in the middle of a busy intersection while I was visiting Santa Barbara from out of town. I had it towed to Perry Ford. The service staff was polite. They took my information and said they would diagnose my car (a $140 charge) and call me. Also told me I should get a rental car because they wouldn‚Äôt be able to fix my car that day. I asked if Ford would give me anything for my car and was told NO. I went to a Toyota dealer. < Text>
Perry Ford did complete the safety recall on my vehicle, however I had two issues with their systems.
1. It took two phone calls to get my appointment.  The first time I called an auto-attendant answered the phone and told me I would have to wait, which I did.  When a person answered they had to transfer me to someone else.  I then had to wait again, finally the system hung up on me.  I my second call it was similar system: auto-attendant answer, wait, a person answered and had to transfer me, wait, a second person answered and had to transfer me to a third, wait again, finally could make my appointment.  I obviously hate auto-attendants that have no purpose but to delay when you can talk to a real person.  Then having to get transferred twice clearly shows a poorly designed system. (keep in mind the people were friendly and likely just doing their jobs as taught.)
2.  Time to complete the job.  During the conversation when I made the appointment, I was told the repair was a simple 10 minute procedure.  When I arrived the person helping me said it might take as long as 30 minutes to fit in.  Once I started waiting it took a full hour.  Again, I believe the people were doing their best and working with a system that does not support their success.

I hope Perry Ford and take criticism like this and actually improve the customer experience.</Text>

< text>
Overpriced and a waste of time!
Made an appointment for my truck to get an oil change and take a look at a tire pressure monitoring system (tpms) issue. Got there as soon as they opened for my appointment and explained what I needed to get done. Without even diagnosing it issue, their service guy Mike claimed I would need to get the sensor replaced within my tire and tried to smoothly add a $200 charge to my already $60 oil change. For anyone wondering, that's like seeing a check engine light on and claiming to know the problem without hooking it up to a code reader. After telling him not to fix that issue I was asked if i had someone coming to pick me up so I asked how long the wait was going to be. That's when I was told it would take several hours. Ended up taking almost 3 hours for an oil change. I understand that if I'd brought it in without an appointment but the whole point of making an appointment is so I don't have to waste a chunk of my day for a oil change that takes me less than 20 minutes to do at home. This is only my experience but I've heard of other major issues with this service department in regards to lying about completing services that were not completed. I will never be going back and would reccomend all others to think twice before having their vehicle serviced by this Ford dealership.< /text>

I bought a 2012 Focus from Perry Ford in March of 2012.  Since I already knew what I wanted, I simply called Erica Smith and told her what I was looking for.  She said she would look for me and a few days later called and said, she found the car I wanted.  She even suggested, since I live in Bakersfield, to have the car delivered to my doorstep. I have never experienced that type of customer service before.  Several days later the car was in my driveway and I didn't even need to leave my home.
Recently my wife and I were discussing trading in my F150 for an Edge in 2014.  Out of the blue Erica sent me an email asking if there were anything she could do for me (she didn't know I was looking).  After discussing with my wife we decided to act on the invite and lease the Edge now.  Again, Erica is the best example of someone going out of her way to accommodate the customers needs. Great customer service doesn't happen by accident.</Text>

A definition of insanity is taking the same action repeatedly and expecting a different result each time. You have my contact information in both my lease paperwork and in the lengthy letter I wrote to you in April asking for your help. Now YOU reach out to ME!!!!!!

STAY AWAY! Perry Ford/Mazda was shockingly incompetent in preparing my lease paperwork in December, 2018 for a Mazda CX 5, calling me in 4 times before they got it correct. On my third trip in, the paperwork rep chuckled, ‚ÄúThird time‚Äôs the charm.‚Äù On my 4th trip in to sign, which was about 2 weeks after I'd taken possession, a different paperwork rep casually mentioned as I was leaving that I would be getting a check back from the dealership for my 1st month's lease payment. He said Mazda Corp had a promotional when I first signed up, offering the 1st month free, but that Perry had failed to credit me that amount and I'd paid the first month myself with my down payment. In the meantime, Mazda Corp. had sent a generic letter to me confirming they would be paying my first month. About 2 months later I realized I'd never gotten a check from Perry so I went into the dealership to check up. After going over the details, they agreed I was owed the first month's payment and said the request for payment just needed a signature from someone who was not available at the moment. I was told it would be handled, with the comment: "Now if you don't get an email from me by the end of today, don't hesitate to get in touch with me to remind me." What???? I didn't hear back but was too fed up with Perry and insulted to think I would need to continue pursuit of the reimbursement myself. I waited for a check for the next month without result. I called the dealership to get the general manager's name and wrote a letter with all of these details and requested action. A couple of days later I got a voicemail from the general manager saying he would look into the matter. Several weeks have passed by now and the only word I've heard from Perry was a phone call from the service department saying they'd like to service my Mazda for me. I will not be returning to Perry Mazda for any reason!! Perry Ford, Santa Barbara California
Date of Service: May 3, 2019
Vehicle: 1996 Ford F-250 Diesel
Issue: Leaking oil, approximately 1 cup per hour
Additional Info: Day 2 of a 100-day RV trip originating from Phoenix

While camping at Santa Oso 30 minutes from Santa Barbara we noticed our truck was leaking a steady stream of oil.  Being hundreds of miles from home we were very concerned about finding a mechanic on a Friday afternoon to diagnose and repair our truck before the end of our reservation in three days. We are very glad to have found Omar and Steve at Perry Ford in Santa Barbara.  Steve starting working on the issue right away and Omar discussed what we should expect from his service team and he quickly got us a rental car with a much better discount than we could on our own.   Less than 2 hour later Omar called and informed us that the truck was ready.   As you can imagine we were very pleased and excited.

Thank you, Omar, Steve and Perry Ford.  I know enough about business to know that this kind of customer service comes from the top down and is indicative of the company‚Äôs culture, philosophy and mission statement.</Text>

< Review>
I brought my Ford expedition into Perry Ford for a fuel pump, they told me it would cost$1,500.00, highest price on the internet is $840.00 (installed), they said to put on a fuel filter (again price was twice market), they made an error installing and burnt a fuse requiring the whole fuse box to be replaced (also at twice market price), they said to replace differential fluid (also twice market price). A job that should have cost $1,550.00 cost $2,200.00. They don't keep any parts in stock so there's 2 days additional time wasted. They tell you they are giving you a discount but that is BS. < text>
I was hesitant when looking into replacing my aging car, but did trust my favorite service guy at Perry Ford (Mike) to assure me that I would not be pressured by sales. I worked with Jerry Alden and his patience with my many questions, and his willingness to work within MY parameters, not those imposed by a bottom line, was unbelievably refreshing and helpful. I am left with a strong sense that Perry Ford cares more for creating a solid and loyal base of customers, than making a quick buck. In my case that really works. I find myself telling friends that this is a good place to look for a car, better than online where the person does not have a connection with you as a buyer. If the ONLY motivation is to sell sell sell, and not develop trust with a customer, success has to be short lived. Companies like Sears with appliances, or large chain car sales companies, and others that function on the bottom line without earning the trust of buyers, and not offering a truly quality produc are developing a very poor reputations indeed. Why so many companies have not figured out that it matters how you treat customers is a mystery to me. I felt LISTENED to, and that the interest was in satisfying my needs. I now have a car that exceeds my expectations, and none of the doubt and regret that can follow this process.< /text>

< Text>
I came in (appointment scheduled) needing an oil change, front calipers, and my transmission checked. They informed me that I needed more done on my car then expected. I told them I could not afford the fixing at this time so I would just like my oil changed and my transmission looked over. The man gave me a look of annoyance. My appointment was scheduled at 8:00 AM. After 5 hours of waiting I walked over to my consultant to see what was going on. My consultant (Grant) was very rude. He sternly told me that they were doing their job and I should just go and catch a ride. He said jobs take time and he told me that I should have gotten a ride earlier. I'm no expert on cars but I know an oil change takes less than an hour and to inspect my transmission doesn't take up the rest of that 5 hours I waited. Honestly if that was the case I would expect someone to inform me what is going on and give me an estimated finish time or explain what is going on with their inspection. Another hour went by and I was informed that my paperwork was then just given to the technician to look at my transmission. I finally stepped up and asked for a manager. The front desk couldn't find him so she brought me my consultant. He argued and yelled at me saying he told me to leave. Needless to say I left with an oil change, an extra $101 fee for "inspection". <userid>116538580352160383024</userid><Pics>None< /Pics>< Review>
Service department review:

This has been the worst experience.

I got a letter about a recall for my Ford.  I called on Thursday (12/31) to make an appointment for Monday (1/4).  When I brought in my car on Monday, they didn't have the right parts.  Why didn't they order the parts when I made the appointment?  So instead of bringing in my car on my day off, I have to miss work on a different day.  I brought my car back in on the next Thursday (1/7).  It is now Monday (1/11).  I've been without my car for 5 days for what was outlined in the recall letter as a single day fix.

Do not get your car serviced here unless you can afford to not have it for the next week or more.</Review>

After the 5 day trial period, I wasn't quite sure if I'd gotten the best deal, so John made me an offer I couldn't resist, dropping my APR and even throwing in maintenance for a year to help me feel really comfortable about buying this car. Angelo's super friendly nature and genuine attitude of helpfulness really made this experience stress-free and I truly felt like a winner with them!  THANK YOU ANGELO!!!!</Review>< gmapID>

<name>Bruce Goetting<//name>< Time>
1363229066319<//Time>
<rate>2< /rate>< text>
Their repair department is simply crooked.  Six months ago my Ford E-350 van had the AC compressor and and aftermarket AC hose replaced by Vreeland Ford in Buelton at a cost of $2300.  A few months later the AC failed and I took my van to Perry Ford in Santa Barbara because it was closer I was told that "all work was warranted by Ford for one year".  The leak was found in one of the two aftermarket hoses.  I was told by Jeff in the service dept that if it was the same hose that was replaced recently at Vreeland Ford, it would be covered by warranty, if not, I would have to pay.  I agreed.  The leak was found but no one could tell me if it was the same part that I already had replaced.  After several days of nothing happening (seems everyone at the Ford dealers are sick all the time), I picked up my van, paid $180 diagnostic fee, and brought it back to Vreeland Ford in Buelton where the original work was done.  They quickly identified that one of the connectors that they had replaced became loose.  They tightened it and the problem was solved at no charge.  I asked Perry Ford to refund the $180 diagnostic fee since the problem was covered under warranty and they refused.  Jeff, the Service Advisor who told me it would be covered under warranty if it was a recently replaced part, now told me that the Service Manager decided that there is no "Ford Warranty" for any repairs that include aftermarket parts.  I asked "If I get my Dodge truck fixed at your Ford repair shop then the warranty is not good at other Ford Factory Service Centers?"  He replied NO.  Funny, because if I get any vehicle fixed at Sears, I can get warranty work done at any other Sears. I will contact Ford Motor Co and eventually Perry Ford will refund that money even if it involves small claims litigation.  BTW I also had my turbo rebuilt at a cost of $1500 during my same visit to Perry Ford so the disputed amount is only a small part of my overall bill.  This experience just highlights their petty thinking.  They want your money and don't care at all if their charges are justified or whether the customer has a legitimate complaint.  It's extreme arrogance.  In order for me to get the refund that I am due, I will need to write letters to Ford Motor Co, file legal claims, etc.

Bruce Goetting, MD
Montecito<//text>

Took advantage of my grandmother<//Text>
< Pictures>

None< /Response>
<Gmap_id>0x80e9151f9d8f52af:0xcaa4a00ed447fd1e< /Gmap_id></record>
</dataset><record>
< Review>
Bait and switch?  Deception?  All they care about is getting your money? You decide.

I contacted Perry Ford/Mazda of Santa Barbara to help me buy a new F-250 King Ranch.  They said they found my vehicle at another dealership and sent me a window sticker.  The information on window stickers includes company codes and jargon.  Nowhere did the window sticker indicate that the truck was a King Ranch, so I emailed them several times to confirm the details of the truck.  Their email replies were vague and confusing, but one reply in particular was: "Yes, this is the truck you asked for."  When I asked to see a photo of the truck, they said they could not provide one because it was coming from another dealer.  Unfortunately, I trusted their word and paid for the vehicle in order to drive it off the lot once it arrived at their dealership.  When the vehicle arrived and it was not what I asked for, they tried to get me to pay them more money to have it painted to look like what I asked for.  I refused to take possession of the vehicle, and told them I wanted my money back.

Perry Ford fought for a month to keep my money.  Every level of the organization pushed to make me take that truck.  They threatened to deliver it to my house on a flat-bed truck.  With no reconciliation in sight, I had to hire a lawyer for the first time in my life.

My attorney reviewed the contracts and email exchanges I had with the dealership and quickly confirmed that I had a solid case and would likely win in arbitration (I had signed away my right to take them to court in the course of the sale).  It was only after I made it clear that I was prepared to go into arbitration with Perry Ford that they began to negotiate with me.  First they offered to buy the truck back as a "trade-in," for significantly less money, though it had never been driven off the lot.  Then they wanted to keep $3000 of my money in order to "rectify the error."  Days before Perry Ford would have had to pay $3200 to begin arbitration, they agreed to give me my money back.  Although relieved by the outcome, I was not reimbursed for the attorney fees.  Furthermore, this was an extremely stressful experience for me.

My biggest complaint is that it is clear at every stage of the negotiation that Perry Ford knew exactly the vehicle that I was asking for and still deceived me into paying for a different vehicle.  This dishonesty is unethical to me, and I hope other consumers do not suffer the same fate.
Please check the reviews before you choose a dealership.  There are several Ford dealerships in Ventura, Oxnard, and the valley with much better reviews who give much better (read: honest) service.  Finally, always lay hands on the vehicle you intend to purchase before you pay for it.  This is probably obvious to most people, but it wasn't to me.  I thought I could trust my local dealership . . . .</Review>
